page.title: 09WANSFORD PARISH COUNCIL
page.content:
The Parish Council is a vital aspect of village life, a group who keep the village running smoothly. The size of the group depends on the amount of people in the village. There is always a Chairperson, Clerk and Treasurer, as well as the councillors themselves. In Wansford the council meets normally in the Village Hall. If this is not available they will meet in the church or parish room. The Parish Council is responsible for seeing to local problems. It needs to keep footpaths, bus- shelters and other public amenities maintained for the villagers to use. The Parish Council is an organisation to keep the village in order and to ensure its well being.
{
